items.label: Execute a SSH command on a Cluster

build/dapp/advanced/add-lux-programmatic.title: Add Lux Network Programmatically
build/dapp/advanced/add-lux-programmatic.description: This document shows how to integrate Lux Network with your Dapp, either by Core or MetaMask.

build/dapp/advanced/adjusting-gas-price-.title: Adjusting Gas Price During High Network Activity
build/dapp/advanced/adjusting-gas-price-.description: This tutorial will help users to adjust their priority fee and max fee cap during high network activity and take advantage of the benefits of dynamic fee transactions.

build/dapp/advanced/integrate-exchange.title: C-Chain Exchange Integration
build/dapp/advanced/integrate-exchange.description: The objective of this document is to provide a brief overview of how to integrate with the EVM-Compatible Lux C-Chain.

build/dapp/advanced/sending-transactions.title: Sending Transactions with Dynamic Fees using JavaScript
build/dapp/advanced/sending-transactions.description: This tutorial will help users to send transactions with dynamic fee settings to adjust their priority fee and max fee cap during high network activity using javascript.

build/dapp/c-chain-evm.title: Building on the C-Chain
build/dapp/c-chain-evm.description: Lux C-Chain is a blockchain that can run all the Solidity smart contracts from Ethereum, but with much greater transaction bandwidth and instant finality from Lux's revolutionary consensus mechanism.

build/dapp/chain-settings.title: Lux C-Chain Settings
build/dapp/chain-settings.description: Launching any new or existing Solidity decentralized app on Lux C-Chain fosters the same developer experience as Ethereum, but benefits from the security, speed, and interoperability of the Lux Network. Get connected with Lux C-Chain Settings

build/dapp/explorers.title: Lux Block Explorer
build/dapp/explorers.description: These Lux Block Explorers allow you to query historical Mainnet, testnet, and Subnet block data.

build/dapp/launch-dapp.title: Launch an Ethereum Dapp on Lux
build/dapp/launch-dapp.description: Launching any new or existing Solidity decentralized app on Lux C-Chain fosters the same developer experience as Ethereum, but benefits from the security, speed, and interoperability of the Lux Network.

build/dapp/smart-contracts/abigen.title: Interact with a Solidity Smart Contract from a Golang Application
build/dapp/smart-contracts/abigen.description: This tutorial demonstrates how to compile a solidity contract into Golang to deploy and call contracts programmatically.

build/dapp/smart-contracts/erc-20.title: Create an ERC-20 Token Using Solidity
build/dapp/smart-contracts/erc-20.description: ERC-20 tokens are the most fundamental and essential concept in Ethereum. This same token standard is adopted in the Lux ecosystem.

build/dapp/smart-contracts/get-funds-fau.title: Get Test Funds from the Testnet Faucet
build/dapp/smart-contracts/get-funds-fau.description: This tutorial focuses on how to get a "drip" of LUX from the Testnet faucet.

build/dapp/smart-contracts/nfts/deploy-c.title: Deploy an ERC-721 NFT Collection on Lux
build/dapp/smart-contracts/nfts/deploy-c.description: This tutorial will walkthrough deploying a basic ERC-721 (NFT) smart contract on the Lux Network. This is a beginner friendly tutorial; No previous development experience necessary.

build/dapp/smart-contracts/nfts/preparin.title: Preparing NFT Files for an ERC721 Smart Contract
build/dapp/smart-contracts/nfts/preparin.description: ERC-721 tokens are one of the most fundamental and essential concepts in Ethereum. This same token standard is adopted in the Lux ecosystem.

build/dapp/smart-contracts/remix-deploy.title: Deploy a Smart Contract on Lux Using Remix and Core
build/dapp/smart-contracts/remix-deploy.description: In this doc, learn how to deploy and test a smart contract on Lux using Remix and Core.

build/dapp/smart-contracts/toolchains/fo.title: Using Foundry with the Lux C-Chain
build/dapp/smart-contracts/toolchains/fo.description: This guide shows how to deploy and interact with smart contracts using foundry on a local Lux Network and the Testnet C-Chain.

build/dapp/smart-contracts/toolchains/ha.title: Using Hardhat with the Lux C-Chain
build/dapp/smart-contracts/toolchains/ha.description: The goal of this guide is to lay out best practices regarding writing, testing and deployment of smart contracts to Lux's C-Chain using Hardhat.

build/dapp/smart-contracts/toolchains/th.title: Deploy a Smart Contract on Lux Using thirdweb
build/dapp/smart-contracts/toolchains/th.description: Launching any new or existing Solidity decentralized app on Lux C-Chain fosters the same developer experience as Ethereum, but benefits from the security, speed, and interoperability of the Lux Network.

build/dapp/smart-contracts/verification/.title: Verifying Smart Contracts Using Hardhat and Snowtrace
build/dapp/smart-contracts/verification/.description: This tutorial walks through verifying a smart contract on a block explorer using Hardhat after deploying it to Lux C-Chain.

build/dapp/smart-contracts/verification/.title: Verify Smart Contracts on the C-Chain Explorer
build/dapp/smart-contracts/verification/.description: This tutorial walks through verifying a smart contract on the Snowtrace block explorer.

build/dapp/testnet-workflow.title: Testnet Workflow
build/dapp/testnet-workflow.description: An end-to-end walkthrough of necessary development activities for a bare-bones decentralized application.

build/subnet/c-chain-vs-subnet.title: When to Build on a Subnet vs. on the C-Chain
build/subnet/c-chain-vs-subnet.description: In this article, we discuss often-overlooked differentiating characteristics of Subnets, with a primary focus on EVM-based applications, to help developers determine the best place to launch their application.

build/subnet/deploy/custom-vm-subnet.title: Create a Subnet with a Custom Virtual Machine
build/subnet/deploy/custom-vm-subnet.description: This tutorial demonstrates the process of creating a Subnet with a custom virtual machine and deploying it locally.

build/subnet/deploy/local-subnet.title: How to Deploy a Subnet on a Local Network
build/subnet/deploy/local-subnet.description: This how-to guide focuses on taking an already created Subnet configuration and deploying it to a local Lux network.

build/subnet/deploy/mainnet-subnet.title: Deploy a Permissioned Subnet on Mainnet
build/subnet/deploy/mainnet-subnet.description: This tutorial demonstrates how to deploy a permissioned Subnet on Lux Mainnet.

build/subnet/deploy/multisig-auth.title: Deploy a Subnet with Multisig Authorization
build/subnet/deploy/multisig-auth.description: This tutorial demonstrates how to deploy a permissioned Subnet on Lux Mainnet.

build/subnet/deploy/on-prod-infra.title: Deploy Subnets on Production Infrastructure
build/subnet/deploy/on-prod-infra.description: This tutorial demonstrates how to deploy a Subnet to production environment.

build/subnet/deploy/testnet-subnet.title: Deploy a Permissioned Subnet on Testnet
build/subnet/deploy/testnet-subnet.description: This tutorial demonstrates how to deploy a permissioned Subnet on Testnet.

build/subnet/elastic/elastic-parameters.title: Elastic Subnets Parameters
build/subnet/elastic/elastic-parameters.description: This reference describes the structural parameters of an Elastic (Permissionless) Subnet and illustrates the constraints they must satisfy.

build/subnet/elastic/transform-to-elasti.title: How to Transform a Permissioned Subnet into an Elastic Subnet
build/subnet/elastic/transform-to-elasti.description: This how-to guide focuses on taking an already created permissioned Subnet and transforming it to an elastic (or permissionless) Subnet.

build/subnet/getting-started.title: What's the Subnet Development Lifecycle?
build/subnet/getting-started.description: Planning a successful Subnet deployment starts by determining your application's needs.

build/subnet/hello-subnet.title: Build Your First Subnet
build/subnet/hello-subnet.description: This tutorial walks you through the process of using Lux-CLI to create a Subnet, deploy it to a local network, and connect to it with Core wallet.

build/subnet/info/troubleshoot-subnet.title: Troubleshooting Subnet Deployments
build/subnet/info/troubleshoot-subnet.description: A reference for tips to resolve common issues while deploying Subnets on Lux.

build/subnet/info/wagmi.title: ZOO Subnet
build/subnet/info/wagmi.description: The ZOO ("We're All Going to Make It") Subnet is a high throughput testbed for EVM (Ethereum Virtual Machine) optimizations. It is parameterized to run at a factor more capacity than Testnet/Mainnet C-Chain and will is used to experiment with release candidates before included in an official Coreth release.

build/subnet/maintain/delete-subnet.title: How to Delete a Subnet
build/subnet/maintain/delete-subnet.description: To delete a created Subnet configuration, run `lux subnet delete <subnetName>`.

build/subnet/maintain/how-to-transfer-fu.title: How to Use Lux-CLI to Transfer P-Chain Funds
build/subnet/maintain/how-to-transfer-fu.description: If you need to send funds to your Subnet control key or need to move funds from one Ledger address index to another, this guide will demostrate how to enable direct transfers between ledger P-Chain addresses using the Lux-CLI command `lux key transfer`.

build/subnet/maintain/pause-resume-subne.title: How to Pause and Resume Local Subnets
build/subnet/maintain/pause-resume-subne.description: Gracefully pause and resume a local subnet while preserving state.

build/subnet/maintain/view-subnets.title: How to View Your Created Subnets
build/subnet/maintain/view-subnets.description: You can list the Subnets you've created with `lux subnet list`.

build/subnet/upgrade/considerations-subn.title: Key Considerations When Upgrading a Subnet
build/subnet/upgrade/considerations-subn.description: This tutorial will guide you through the process of doing various Subnet upgrades and changes including what to watch out for and suggested precautions.

build/subnet/upgrade/customize-a-subnet.title: Customize Your EVM-Powered Subnet
build/subnet/upgrade/customize-a-subnet.description: How to customize a Subnet by utilizing Genesis, Precompile, and Blockchain Configs.

build/subnet/upgrade/upgrade-precompile.title: How to Upgrade Your Subnet-EVM Precompile Configuration
build/subnet/upgrade/upgrade-precompile.description: You can customize Subnet-EVM based Subnets after deployment by enabling and disabling precompiles.

build/subnet/upgrade/upgrade-subnet-vm.title: How to Upgrade a Subnet's Virtual Machine
build/subnet/upgrade/upgrade-subnet-vm.description: This how-to guide explains how to upgrade a deployed Subnet's Virtual Machine.

build/subnet/utility/cross-chain-evm-bri.title: Deploy a Cross-Chain EVM Bridge
build/subnet/utility/cross-chain-evm-bri.description: This tutorial demonstrates the process of deploying a cross-chain bridge between two EVM chains. Build at your own risk.

build/subnet/utility/deploy-smart-contra.title: Deploy a Smart Contract on Your Subnet-EVM Using Remix and Core
build/subnet/utility/deploy-smart-contra.description: This tutorial demonstrates the process of deploying a smart contract to an EVM-based Subnet.

build/subnet/utility/subnet-faucet.title: Enable Testnet Capabilities on a Subnet with Lux Subnet Faucet
build/subnet/utility/subnet-faucet.description: Deploy a custom testnet faucet for your Subnet with features like multiple chain support, custom rate-limiting, CAPTCHA verification, and concurrent transaction handling.

build/vm/create/any-lang-vm.title: How to Build a Simple VM From Scratch
build/vm/create/any-lang-vm.description: This is a language-agnostic high-level documentation explaining the basics of how to get started at implementing your own virtual machine from scratch.

build/vm/create/golang-vm-complex.title: How to Build a Complex Golang VM
build/vm/create/golang-vm-complex.description: Learn how to build a complex virtual machine on Lux using Golang.

build/vm/create/golang-vm-simple.title: How to Build a Simple Golang VM
build/vm/create/golang-vm-simple.description: Learn how to build a simple virtual machine on Lux using Golang.

build/vm/create/rust-vm.title: How to Build a Simple Rust VM
build/vm/create/rust-vm.description: Learn how to develop virtual machines on Lux using Rust.

build/vm/evm/background-and-reqs.title: Background and Requirements
build/vm/evm/background-and-reqs.description: Setting up your environment to build stateful precompiles in EVM

build/vm/evm/defining-precompile.title: Defining Your Precompile
build/vm/evm/defining-precompile.description: In this guide, we'll define the precompile by implementing the `HelloWorld` interface.

build/vm/evm/defining-tests.title: Writing Test Cases
build/vm/evm/defining-tests.description: In this tutorial, we will go over the different ways we can write test cases for our stateful precompile.

build/vm/evm/deploying-precompile.title: Deploying Your Precompile
build/vm/evm/deploying-precompile.description: In this guide, we will explain the steps to deploy our precompile on a local network.

build/vm/evm/intro.title: Stateful Precompile Generation Tutorial
build/vm/evm/intro.description: Getting started with building stateful precompiles for Subnet-EVM and Precompile-EVM

build/vm/intro.title: Introduction to Virtual Machines
build/vm/intro.description: A Virtual Machine is a blueprint for a blockchain. VMs can define anything you want, but will generally define transactions that are executed and how blocks are created.

deprecated/deploy-a-gnosis-safe-on-your-.title: Deploy a Gnosis Safe on Your Subnet-EVM
deprecated/deploy-a-gnosis-safe-on-your-.description: This document has been deprecated and may contain incorrect/obsolete information.

deprecated/truffle.title: Using Truffle with the Lux C-Chain
deprecated/truffle.description: Launching any new or existing Solidity decentralized app on Lux C-Chain fosters the same developer experience as Ethereum, but benefits from the security, speed, and interoperability of the Lux Network.

disclaimer.title: Disclaimer
disclaimer.description: The Knowledge Base, including all the Help articles on this site, is provided for technical support purposes only, without representation, warranty or guarantee of any kind. Not an offer to sell or solicitation of an offer to buy any security or other regulated financial instrument. Not technical, investment, financial, accounting, tax, legal or other advice; please consult your own professionals. Please conduct your own research before connecting to or interacting with any dapp or third party or making any investment or financial decisions. MoonPay, ParaSwap and any other third party services or dapps you access are offered by third parties unaffiliated with us. Please review this Notice and the Terms of Use.

learn/lux/awm.title: Lux Warp Messaging
learn/lux/awm.description: AWM allows seamless communication between different subnetworks on Lux, enabling developers to establish custom communication protocols.

learn/lux/intro.title: What Is Lux?
learn/lux/intro.description: Lux is an open-source platform for building dApps in an interoperable, decentralized, and highly scalable ecosystem.

learn/lux/lux-consensus.title: Lux Consensus
learn/lux/lux-consensus.description: Lux Consensus is a consensus protocol that is scalable, robust, and decentralized.

learn/lux/lux-platform.title: The Primary Network
learn/lux/lux-platform.description: Lux features 3 built-in blockchains which includes Exchange Chain (X-Chain), Platform Chain (P-Chain), and Contract Chain (C-Chain). More info here.

learn/lux/mainnet.title: Lux Mainnet
learn/lux/mainnet.description: Lux Mainnet is the final and production-ready version of the blockchain where users can interact with the network and transact with real world assets.

learn/lux/subnets-overview.title: What Is a Subnet?
learn/lux/subnets-overview.description: A Subnet is a dynamic set of validators working together to achieve consensus on the state of a set of blockchain networks.

learn/lux/testnet.title: Testnet
learn/lux/testnet.description: Testnet is the official testnet for the Lux ecosystem.

learn/lux/virtual-machines.title: Virtual Machines
learn/lux/virtual-machines.description: Virtual Machine is a virtual environment inside blockchain networks that executes smart contracts and transactions according to predetermined rules and protocols.

nodes/configure/avalanchego-config-flags.title: Luxd Configs and Flags
nodes/configure/avalanchego-config-flags.description: This documents list all available configuration and flags for Luxd.

nodes/configure/chain-config-flags.title: Chain Configs
nodes/configure/chain-config-flags.description: Reference for all available chain config options and flags.

nodes/configure/luxd-config-flags.title: Luxd Configs and Flags
nodes/configure/luxd-config-flags.description: This documents list all available configuration and flags for Luxd.

nodes/configure/subnet-configs.title: Subnet Configs
nodes/configure/subnet-configs.description: Reference for all available Subnet config options and flags.

nodes/maintain/background-service-config.title: Run a Lux Node as a Background Service
nodes/maintain/background-service-config.description: This page demonstrates how to set up a `luxd.service` file to enable a manually deployed validator node to run in the background of a server instead of in the terminal directly.

nodes/maintain/node-backup-and-restore.title: Node Backup and Restore
nodes/maintain/node-backup-and-restore.description: Should your machine ever have a failure due to either hardware or software issues, it's best to be prepared for such a situation by making a backup.

nodes/maintain/node-bootstrap.title: Node Bootstrap
nodes/maintain/node-bootstrap.description: Node Bootstrap is the process where a node *securely* downloads linear chain blocks to recreate the latest state of the chain locally. Bootstrapping a node is a multi-step process which requires downloading the chains required by the Primary Network (that is, the C-Chain, P-Chain, and X-Chain), as well as the chains required by any additional Subnets that the node explicitly tracks.

nodes/maintain/notify.title: Lux Notify
nodes/maintain/notify.description: Lux Notify is an active monitoring system that checks a validator's responsiveness each minute. To receive email alerts if a validator becomes unresponsive or out-of-date, sign up with the Lux Notify tool.

nodes/maintain/run-offline-pruning.title: Run C-Chain Offline Pruning
nodes/maintain/run-offline-pruning.description: In this doc, learn how to run offline pruning on your node to reduce its disk usage.

nodes/maintain/setting-up-node-monitorin.title: Monitor a Lux Node
nodes/maintain/setting-up-node-monitorin.description: This tutorial demonstrates how to set up infrastructure to monitor an instance of Luxd.

nodes/maintain/upgrade-your-luxd-node.title: Upgrade Your Luxd Node
nodes/maintain/upgrade-your-luxd-node.description: This tutorial demonstrates how to set up infrastructure to monitor an instance of Luxd.

nodes/README.title: üîó Nodes Quick Links
nodes/README.description: This section provides documents on how to build and maintain a Lux Node, and then validate the Lux network using a Lux Node.

nodes/run/FAQ.title: Common Errors While Building a Node
nodes/run/FAQ.description: If you experience any issues building your node, here are some common errors and possible solutions.

nodes/run/node-manually.title: Run a Lux Node Manually
nodes/run/node-manually.description: The quickest way to learn about Lux is to run a node and interact with the network. This tutorial demonstrates how to install and run a Lux node, and connect to the Lux Network by compiling a node from source and running it manually.

nodes/run/subnet-node.title: Run a Subnet Node
nodes/run/subnet-node.description: Detailed instructions for running a Lux node that tracks a Subnet.

nodes/run/third-party/aws-marketplace-on.title: Launch a Lux Validator on AWS with One Click
nodes/run/third-party/aws-marketplace-on.description: This tutorial will guide you through spinning up a Lux node via the one-click validator node through the AWS Marketplace. This includes subscribing to the software, launching it on EC2, connecting to the node over ssh, calling curl commands, adding the node as a validator on the Testnet network using the Lux Web wallet, and confirming the node is a pending validator.

nodes/run/third-party/aws-node.title: Run a Lux Node with Amazon Web Services (AWS)
nodes/run/third-party/aws-node.description: This tutorial will guide you through setting up a Lux node on Amazon Web Services (AWS). Cloud services like AWS are a good way to ensure that your node is highly secure, available, and accessible.

nodes/run/third-party/google-cloud-node.title: Run a Lux Node with Google Cloud Platform
nodes/run/third-party/google-cloud-node.description: Launch a Lux Node on Google Cloud Platform.

nodes/run/third-party/microsoft-azure-no.title: Run a Lux Node with Microsoft Azure
nodes/run/third-party/microsoft-azure-no.description: Running a validator and staking with Lux using Microsoft Azure infrastructure provides extremely competitive rewards. Find out more info here.

nodes/run/with-installer/advance-config-.title: Node Configuration and Maintenance
nodes/run/with-installer/advance-config-.description: In this tutorial, you'll learn about advanced Lux node configuration options and maintenance tasks.

nodes/run/with-installer/installing-luxd.title: Installing Lux Node Using the Script
nodes/run/with-installer/installing-luxd.description: In this tutorial, you'll learn how to download and install Lux Node using the installation script.

nodes/run/with-installer/managing-luxd.title: Managing Lux Node
nodes/run/with-installer/managing-luxd.description: In this tutorial, you'll learn how to manage your Lux Node.

nodes/run/with-installer/preparing-your-.title: Run a Lux Node Using the Install Script
nodes/run/with-installer/preparing-your-.description: In this tutorial, you'll learn how to prepare your environment for Luxd installation and configure your network settings.

nodes/system-requirements.title: System Requirements for Running a Lux Node
nodes/system-requirements.description: Lux is an incredibly lightweight protocol, so nodes can run on commodity hardware. Note that as network usage increases, hardware requirements may change.

nodes/validate/add-a-validator.title: Add a Node to the Validator Set
nodes/validate/add-a-validator.description: This section provides documents on how to build and maintain a Luxd node, and then validate the Lux network using a Luxd node.

nodes/validate/how-to-stake.title: How to Stake on Lux
nodes/validate/how-to-stake.description: This section provides documents on how to stake LUX on the Lux Network.

nodes/validate/validate-or-delegate.title: The Differences Between Validation and Delegation on Lux
nodes/validate/validate-or-delegate.description: This section details the difference between staking and delegating on Lux.

nodes/validate/what-is-staking.title: What Is Staking?
nodes/validate/what-is-staking.description: Staking is an essential part of proof-of-stake (PoS) consensus mechanisms used by many blockchain networks, including Lux.

reference/luxd/admin-api.title: Admin API
reference/luxd/admin-api.description: This page is an overview of the Admin API associated with Luxd.

reference/luxd/auth-api.title: Auth API
reference/luxd/auth-api.description: This page is an overview of the Auth API associated with Luxd.

reference/luxd/c-chain/api.title: Contract Chain API
reference/luxd/c-chain/api.description: This page is an overview of the C-Chain API associated with Luxd.

reference/luxd/c-chain/txn-format.title: C-Chain Transaction Format
reference/luxd/c-chain/txn-format.description: This page is an overview of the Coreth atomic transaction format associated with Luxd C-Chain API.

reference/luxd/health-api.title: Health API
reference/luxd/health-api.description: This page is an overview of the Health API associated with Luxd. This API can be used for measuring node health.

reference/luxd/index-api.title: Index API
reference/luxd/index-api.description: This page is an overview of the Index API associated with Luxd.

reference/luxd/info-api.title: Info API
reference/luxd/info-api.description: This page is an overview of the Info API associated with Luxd.

reference/luxd/ipc-api.title: IPC API
reference/luxd/ipc-api.description: This page is an overview of the IPC API associated with Luxd.

reference/luxd/keystore-api.title: Keystore API
reference/luxd/keystore-api.description: This page is an overview of the Keystore API associated with Luxd.

reference/luxd/metrics-api.title: Metrics API
reference/luxd/metrics-api.description: This page is an overview of the Metrics API associated with Luxd.

reference/luxd/p-chain/api.title: Platform Chain API
reference/luxd/p-chain/api.description: This page is an overview of the P-Chain API associated with Luxd.

reference/luxd/p-chain/txn-format.title: P-Chain Transaction Format
reference/luxd/p-chain/txn-format.description: This page is an overview of the transaction format associated with Luxd P-Chain API.

reference/luxd/x-chain/api.title: X-Chain API
reference/luxd/x-chain/api.description: This page is an overview of the Exchange Chain (X-Chain) API associated with Luxd.

reference/luxd/x-chain/txn-format.title: X-Chain Transaction Format
reference/luxd/x-chain/txn-format.description: This page is an overview of the AVM transaction format associated with Luxd X-Chain API.

reference/README.title: üîó Reference Quick Links
reference/README.description: Luxd is the node implementation for the Lux network - a blockchain platform with high throughput and blazing fast transactions. This page is overview of the APIs associated with Luxd.

reference/standards/avalanche-network-pr.title: Lux Network Protocol
reference/standards/avalanche-network-pr.description: Lux network defines the core communication format between Lux nodes.

reference/standards/cryptographic-primit.title: Cryptographic Primitives
reference/standards/cryptographic-primit.description: This file summarizes the type and kind of cryptography used by Lux at the network and blockchain layers.

reference/standards/guides/banff-changes.title: Banff Changes
reference/standards/guides/banff-changes.description: This document specifies the changes in Lux Banff, which was released in Luxd v1.10.0.

reference/standards/guides/issuing-api-c.title: Issuing API Calls
reference/standards/guides/issuing-api-c.description: This guide explains how to make calls to APIs exposed by Lux nodes.

reference/standards/guides/txn-fees.title: Lux Transaction Fee
reference/standards/guides/txn-fees.description: In order to prevent spam, transactions require the payment of a transaction fee.

reference/standards/guides/x-chain-migra.title: X-Chain Migration Guide
reference/standards/guides/x-chain-migra.description: This document summarizes all of the changes made to the X-Chain API to support Lux Cortina (v1.10.0).

reference/standards/network-protocol.title: Lux Network Protocol
reference/standards/network-protocol.description: Lux network defines the core communication format between Lux nodes.

reference/standards/serialization-primit.title: Serialization Primitives
reference/standards/serialization-primit.description: This document describes how primitive types are encoded on the Lux platform.

reference/subnet-evm/api.title: Subnet-EVM API
reference/subnet-evm/api.description: This page is an overview of the Subnet-EVM API associated with Luxd.

tooling/cli.title: Lux-CLI
tooling/cli.description: Lux-CLI is a command-line tool that gives developers access to everything Lux. This release specializes in helping developers build and test Subnets.

tooling/cli-guides/create-a-validator-aw.title: Run a Lux Validator on AWS with One Lux-CLI Command
tooling/cli-guides/create-a-validator-aw.description: This page demonstrates how to deploy Lux validators using just one Lux-CLI command.

tooling/cli-guides/create-a-validator-gc.title: Run a Lux Validator on GCP with One Lux-CLI Command
tooling/cli-guides/create-a-validator-gc.description: This page demonstrates how to deploy Lux validators using just one Lux-CLI command.

tooling/cli-guides/import-subnet.title: How to Import a Subnet into Lux-CLI
tooling/cli-guides/import-subnet.description: This guide demonstrates the process of importing a Subnet to the Lux-CLI to enable better management of the Subnet's configuration. This how-to uses the ZOO Subnet deployed on Testnet as the example Subnet.

tooling/cli-guides/install-cli.title: Install Lux-CLI
tooling/cli-guides/install-cli.description: This guide demonstrates how to install Lux-CLI.

tooling/cli-guides/node-ssh.title: Execute a SSH command on a Cluster
tooling/cli-guides/node-ssh.description: This page demonstrates how to execute a SSH command on all nodes of a Cluster using the Lux-CLI.

tooling/cli-guides/run-with-docker.title: How to Run Lux-CLI with Docker
tooling/cli-guides/run-with-docker.description: This guide demonstrates how to run Lux-CLI in a docker container.

tooling/cli-guides/setup-a-devnet.title: Setup a Devnet Using Lux-CLI
tooling/cli-guides/setup-a-devnet.description: This page demonstrates how to setup a Devnet of cloud-based validators using the Lux-CLI.

tooling/cli-guides/stop-node.title: Stop Nodes Originally Created with Lux-CLI
tooling/cli-guides/stop-node.description: This page provides instructions for halting cloud server nodes established by Lux-CLI.

tooling/cli-guides/upload-a-custom-vm-to.title: Deploy a Custom VM Using Lux-CLI
tooling/cli-guides/upload-a-custom-vm-to.description: This page demonstrates how to deploy a blockchain run with a custom virtual machine using cloud-based validators using the Lux-CLI.

tooling/cli-guides/validate-primary-netw.title: Configure Nodes to Validate the Primary Network with Lux-CLI
tooling/cli-guides/validate-primary-netw.description: This page demonstrates how to configure nodes to validate the Lux Primary Network. Validation via Lux-CLI is currently only supported on Testnet.

tooling/cli-guides/validate-subnets.title: Configure a Node to Validate a Subnet with Lux-CLI
tooling/cli-guides/validate-subnets.description: This page demonstrates how to configure nodes to validate a Lux Subnet. Validation via Lux-CLI is currently only supported on Testnet.

tooling/glacier.title: Glacier API
tooling/glacier.description: The Glacier API is a performant API that allows web3 developers to more easily access the indexed blockchain data they need to build powerful applications on top of Lux's primary and subnetworks as well as Ethereum.

tooling/indexers.title: üóÑÔ∏è Indexers
tooling/indexers.description: tools or services that facilitate efficient and quick access to data stored on Lux network.

tooling/lux-plugin-manager.title: Lux Plugin Manager
tooling/lux-plugin-manager.description: Lux Plugin Manager is a command-line tool to manage virtual machines binaries on existing Luxd instances. It enables to add/remove nodes to Subnets, upgrade the VM plugin binaries as new versions get released to the plugin repository.

tooling/luxd-installer.title: Luxd Installer
tooling/luxd-installer.description: Luxd Installer is a shell (bash) script that installs Luxd on any Linux computer. This script sets up full, running node in a matter of minutes with minimal user input required. This is convenient if you want to run the node as a service on a standalone Linux installation, for example to set up a (Subnet) validator, use the node as a private RPC server and similar uses. It also makes upgrading or reinstalling the nodes easy.

tooling/luxd-postman-collection/data-vis.title: Data Visualization
tooling/luxd-postman-collection/data-vis.description: The Luxd Postman collection includes all the public API calls that are available on Luxd instance, allowing you to quickly issue commands to your node and see the response, without having to copy and paste long and complicated `curl` commands.

tooling/luxd-postman-collection/making-a.title: Making API Calls
tooling/luxd-postman-collection/making-a.description: The Luxd Postman collection includes all the public API calls that are available on Luxd instance, allowing you to quickly issue commands to your node and see the response, without having to copy and paste long and complicated `curl` commands.

tooling/luxd-postman-collection/setup.title: Setting up Postman
tooling/luxd-postman-collection/setup.description: The Luxd Postman collection includes all the public API calls that are available on Luxd instance, allowing you to quickly issue commands to your node and see the response, without having to copy and paste long and complicated `curl` commands.

tooling/luxd-postman-collection/variable.title: Variables
tooling/luxd-postman-collection/variable.description: The Luxd Postman collection includes all the public API calls that are available on Luxd instance, allowing you to quickly issue commands to your node and see the response, without having to copy and paste long and complicated `curl` commands.

tooling/luxjs-api.title: LuxJS API
tooling/luxjs-api.description: LuxJS is a JavaScript Library for interfacing with the Lux platform. It is built using TypeScript and intended to support both browser and Node.js. The LuxJS library allows one to issue commands to the Lux node APIs.

tooling/luxjs-guides/create-an-asset-on-.title: Create an Asset on the X-Chain
tooling/luxjs-guides/create-an-asset-on-.description: LuxJS is a JavaScript Library for interfacing with the Lux platform. It is built using TypeScript and intended to support both browser and Node.js. The LuxJS library allows one to issue commands to the Lux node APIs.

tooling/luxjs-guides/cross-chain-transfe.title: Transfer LUX Tokens Between Chains
tooling/luxjs-guides/cross-chain-transfe.description: LuxJS is a JavaScript Library for interfacing with the Lux platform. It is built using TypeScript and intended to support both browser and Node.js. The LuxJS library allows one to issue commands to the Lux node APIs.

tooling/luxjs-guides/generate-a-txid-usi.title: Generate a Transaction ID Using LuxJS
tooling/luxjs-guides/generate-a-txid-usi.description: LuxJS is a JavaScript Library for interfacing with the Lux platform. It is built using TypeScript and intended to support both browser and Node.js. The LuxJS library allows one to issue commands to the Lux node APIs.

tooling/luxjs-guides/generate-key-pair.title: Manual Creation of Public-Private Key Pairs using LuxJS
tooling/luxjs-guides/generate-key-pair.description: LuxJS is a JavaScript Library for interfacing with the Lux platform. It is built using TypeScript and intended to support both browser and Node.js. The LuxJS library allows one to issue commands to the Lux node APIs.

tooling/luxjs-guides/manage-x-chain-keys.description: LuxJS is a JavaScript Library for interfacing with the Lux platform. It is built using TypeScript and intended to support both browser and Node.js. The LuxJS library allows one to issue commands to the Lux node APIs.

tooling/luxjs-guides/multisig-utxos-with.title: Multi Signature UTXOs with LuxJS
tooling/luxjs-guides/multisig-utxos-with.description: LuxJS is a JavaScript Library for interfacing with the Lux platform. It is built using TypeScript and intended to support both browser and Node.js. The LuxJS library allows one to issue commands to the Lux node APIs.

tooling/luxjs-guides/send-an-asset-on-th.title: Send an Asset on the X-Chain
tooling/luxjs-guides/send-an-asset-on-th.description: LuxJS is a JavaScript Library for interfacing with the Lux platform. It is built using TypeScript and intended to support both browser and Node.js. The LuxJS library allows one to issue commands to the Lux node APIs.

tooling/luxjs-overview.title: LuxJS Overview
tooling/luxjs-overview.description: LuxJS is a JavaScript Library for interfacing with the Lux platform. It is built using TypeScript and intended to support both browser and Node.js. The LuxJS library allows one to issue commands to the Lux node APIs.

tooling/metrics.title: Metrics API
tooling/metrics.description: Power your analytics with Lux Metrics API such as Subnet usage, staking operations, and more.

tooling/netrunner.title: Lux Netrunner
tooling/netrunner.description: The Lux Netrunner (ANR) allows a user to define, create and interact with a network of Lux nodes. It can be used for development and testing.

tooling/ops.title: Lux Ops
tooling/ops.description: Lux Ops is a suite of commands that enables you to launch and configure network infrastructure (virtual machines or cloud instances) and installs Lux nodes from scratch allowing for various configuration requirements. It provisions all resources required to run a node or network with recommended setups (configurable). This tool is intended for quickly creating, testing and iterating over various Lux network infrastructure configurations for testing and simulation purposes. Use this to play with various setups and reproduce potential problems and issues with possible configurations.

tooling/plugin-manager.title: Lux Plugin Manager
tooling/plugin-manager.description: Lux Plugin Manager is a command-line tool to manage virtual machines binaries on existing Luxd instances. It enables to add/remove nodes to Subnets, upgrade the VM plugin binaries as new versions get released to the plugin repository.

tooling/README.title: üîó Tooling Quick Links
tooling/README.description: The Lux Ecosystem includes a multitude of tooling, maintenance, testing services, including a wide range of helpful resources and utilities for developers building on the platform. These tools are designed to streamline development, improve integration, and maximize the potential of decentralized applications and custom blockchains in the Lux ecosystem.

tooling/rpc-providers.title: üîå RPC Providers
tooling/rpc-providers.description: There are multiple RPC providers which will work as intermediaries to help you interact with the Lux network. You'll experience different latency levels depending on the provider's configurations. You can potentially use multiple providers for redundancy and balancing.
